author: .vbuterin
content:
> I don't think it is impossible if we require 256 blocks of state changes as part of concensus.

This is unfortunately probably nonviable because it would negate the key benefit of statelessness in the context of eth2: the ability for nodes to only verify eth1 blocks if they're part of a committee

author: sky.cactus
content: This is in the context of sharding I assume?  And committees are not long lived things, so someone may be part of committee for shard A one block then committee for shard B next block?
